items.summary: New research shows that there were over 1,000 reported data breaches in the first half of 2021, impacting millions of Americans.

items.title: CrowdStrike sees cybersecurity innovation hitting warp speed with agentic AI
items.summary: CrowdStrike sees cybersecurity innovation accelerating with agentic AI, transforming threat detection and response. The traditional reactive approach to breaches is being replaced by a smarter, faster model.

items.summary: Redwood is repurposing GM’s EV batteries into energy storage - General Motors and Redwood Materials are joining forces to take EV battery tech beyond the road and onto the grid.

items.summary: Tech layoffs in 2025 by big companies like Microsoft, Google, and Meta are shedding thousands of workers, sparking discussions on the motivations behind the workforce reductions.

items.title: Supernova Cinematography: How NASA’s Roman Space Telescope Will Create a Movie of Exploding Stars
items.summary: The Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope is preparing for its science operations by running simulations, including creating a movie of exploding stars like supernovae. The telescope is set to launch in May 2027.

items.title: The party trick called LLM
items.summary: The party trick called LLM - Large Language Models can be deceiving as they place words in a row rather than producing language, leading to the false impression of interacting with a clever computer. This raises ethical concerns about the potential for misinformation and unreliable information being spread by these models.

items.title: 30 Years Ago, Matt Drudge’s Email Newsletter Changed Media Forever
items.summary: 30 years ago, Matt Drudge's email newsletter revolutionized media before platforms like Twitter existed. Drudge's headline-driven website played a major role in shaping today's political media landscape, and its influence continues to be felt three decades later.
